title: Keller-Sutter auspica colloqui di pace tra Ucraina e Russia al vertice di Tirana
cleaned_sentences: The Swiss president participates in the European summit and discusses duties with the USA, looking for quick solutions The president of the Confederation Karin Keller-Sutter hopes for talks for peace between Ukraine and Russia.
Kiev seems ready to sit at the negotiation table, he said upon his arrival at the top of the European political community (CPE) in Tirana.
"We will see if you arrive at a solution or not," he said, referring to the meetings of Istanbul between Moscow and Kiev.
However, the situation seems quite tense.
Sunday - when the president will be in Rome for the pope's intronation - "maybe there will be more clarity," he underlined.
Keller-Sutter represents Switzerland in the Albanian capital for the European summit.
Here he will meet "almost all".
A longer interview is expected that the Danish premier puts Frederiksen.
Copenhagen will take the Presidency of the European Union Council for six months in July.
The meeting of Tirana was invited 47 between heads of government and state, as well as European institutions.
Also on the international front, the technical discussions of the Confederation with the United States on customs duties continue.
Both parts hope an acceleration of the negotiations, highlighted Keller-Sutter on the sidelines of the summit.
31% customs duties are so high that for use in Switzerland it is vital to avoid such an increase.
"For this we have to find a solution quickly.
At the moment I can't tell you what it will look like."
There is currently no negotiating mandate, but a declaration of intent has been sent to Washington.
The discussions with the US also focus on non -tariff obstacles to trade, such as tax issues or alleged Swiss monetary manipulations.
The president of the Confederation firmly rejected these accusations: "The Swiss National Bank does not handle currencies, is independent".
His mandate is aimed at price stability.
Keller-Sutter did not specify if meetings with US representatives are scheduled in Rome on Sunday.
